headline: Elon Musk's xAI To Simulate Software Giants Like Microsoft, Calling It 'Macrohard'
summary: Elon Musk has announced plans to simulate software companies such as Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) using artificial intelligence (AI). What Happened: Musk’s AI firm, xAI, is said to be creating an AI-only software company named “Macrohard.” Musk characterized the project as “very real”, implying that software companies like Microsoft, which do not produce physical hardware, could theoretically be entirely simulated using AI. Join @xAI and help build a purely AI software company called Macr

headline: Decimal Point Analytics Launches DocuAgentIQ - Agentic AI Platform Transforming Document Workflows in SBA & CRE Lending
summary: MUMBAI, India, Aug. 23, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Decimal Point Analytics today announced DocuAgentIQ, a purpose-built Agentic AI platform that modernizes document-heavy work across SBA and CRE lending. headline: Can the AI data center boom be stopped? Meet some opponents with battle plans.
summary: With the rapid advancement of AI, Big Tech has expanded data centers at a torrid pace with seemingly nothing to stop them. But, against the odds, local opponents are starting to make some headway — either by getting concessions from companies or slowing them down.

headline: Why Is Golar LNG’s (GLNG) FLNG Gimi Launch Key to Its Future Growth Blueprint?
summary: Golar LNG Limited recently reported its second-quarter 2025 results, highlighting revenue of US$75.67 million, net income of US$15.64 million, and the Board's approval of a US$0.25 per share dividend payable in early September, with key operational milestones including FLNG Gimi's start of a 20-year lease with BP and a new FLNG charter investment decision by SESA also announced. While quarterly earnings were lower than some analysts expected, contract wins and project commencements further...

headline: Does Charter’s (CHTR) Legal Scrutiny Over Disclosures Reshape Confidence in Its Growth Strategy?
summary: In August 2025, multiple law firms filed class action lawsuits against Charter Communications and certain executives, alleging violations of federal securities laws related to the company's disclosures after the end of the Affordable Connectivity Program and amid declines in internet customers and revenue. These legal actions followed the release of Charter's second quarter results, which showed a decrease in internet subscribers and investor concerns about the quality of reported EBITDA...
